content.raw:
# ðŸ§ª BRUTAL Markdown Test â€” Nested Tables Edition

This file is designed to **break** Markdown table renderers by abusing **HTML tables inside Markdown tables**, nested blockquotes, lists, and code blocks â€” up to **depth 4**. 
If your renderer sanitizes HTML, many nested tables will be flattened or removed.

---

## 0) Reference Links & Assets
Weâ€™ll reuse refs: [CommonMark][cm], [GFM][gfm], logo: ![logo][logo]

[cm]: https://spec.commonmark.org/
[gfm]: https://github.github.com/gfm/
[logo]: https://via.placeholder.com/60x20?text=MD

---

## 1) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ List â†’ Quote â†’ **Markdown Table** w/ **HTML nested table**

> **L1** Quote
> - **L2** List item leading to inner quote
> > **L3** Quote wrapping an outer Markdown table:
> >
> > | Outer A | Outer B |
> > |:-------:|:-------:|
> > | plain | 
> > 
> > Nested A1Nested A2
> > 
> > 
> > L4 Cell 1L4 Cell 2
> > 
> > 
> > Nestedâ€‘2 ANestedâ€‘2 B
> > 
> > 
> > Nestedâ€‘3 XNestedâ€‘3 Y
> > 
> > 
> > Inline code at nestedâ€‘2 depth
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > |
> >
> > Row below nested table:
> > | `code` | **bold** |


---

## 2) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** â†’ Cell contains **List â†’ Quote â†’ Code**

| Col A | Col B |
|------:|:------|
| 12345 | - **L1** bullet in table cell 
| | > **L2** quote in table cell 
| | > - **L3** list within quote 
| | > ```js
| | > // L4 fenced code inside the quoted list
| | > export const deep = 4;
| | > ``` |


---

## 3) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** â†’ Cell contains **HTML table** â†’ Cell contains **Markdown table**

| Level | Content |
|:-----:|:--------|
| L1 | 
| | 
| | HTMLâ€‘L2
| | 
| | MDâ€‘L3 AMDâ€‘L3 B
| | 
| | 
| | | L4 key | L4 val |
| | |:------:|:------:|
| | | a | 1 |
| | 
| | 
| | Nested paragraph with **bold**, *italic*, and `code`.
| | 
| | 
| | 
| | 
| | |


---

## 4) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ **Markdown table** â†’ Cell contains **Checklist** w/ continuation

> Outer context
>
> | Task | Status |
> |--------------|--------|
> | Subtasks | - [ ] L1 todo 
> | | - [x] L2 done 
> | | - [ ] L2 todo 
> | | - [ ] L3 deeper 
> | | - [x] **L4 deepest** (done) |
>
> End of quote.


---

## 5) Depthâ€‘4: **List â†’ Markdown Table â†’ HTML table â†’ Fenced Code**

- **Phase 1 (L1)** intro paragraph.
 - **Phase 2 (L2)** we drop a table:
 | K | V |
 |---|---|
 | A | 
 | | HTML L3: value A
 | | 
 | | # L4 fenced block (inside HTML table)
 | | echo nested
 | | 
 | | 
 | | |
 | B | 2 |


---

## 6) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** with **footnotes, links, images** inside cells

| Feature | Demo |
|:-------:|:-----|
| Footnote | Here is a note[^t1] inside a table cell (L1). |
| Links | [CommonMark spec][cm] and [GFM][gfm] referenced within table (L1). |
| Image | ![logo][logo] |
| Deep | - L1 bullet 
| | > L2 quote inside table 
| | > 1. L3 number 
| | > - L4 bullet |

[^t1]: Footnote defined outside the table but referenced inside.

---

## 7) Depthâ€‘4: **Code fence with pipes** embedded to test table parsing edge cases

| Pipe | Value |
|------|-------|
| show | ```bash
| | echo "a|b|c"
| | printf "1|2|3\n"
| | ``` |


---

## 8) Depthâ€‘4: **Table alignment, inline pipes, escapes** with nested quotes

| Left | Center | Right |
|:------------|:------------:|------:|
| `|` | `\|` | 1000 |
| text \| more | **bold** | -10 |
| > L1 quote | > L1 quote | > L1 quote |
| > - L2 li | > - L2 li | > - L2 li |
| > > L3 | > > L3 | > > L3 |
| > > 1. L4 ordered | > > - L4 bullet | > > `L4 code` |


---

## 9) Depthâ€‘4: **GFM table** inside **blockquote** inside **list** inside **blockquote** (max stress)

> Root quote (L1)
> - List level (L2)
> > Inner quote (L3)
> >
> > | Head A | Head B |
> > |:------:|:------:|
> > | **L4** bold | `L4` code |
> > | sub | sup |


---

## 10) Sanitization probe: raw tags inside cells (expect to be stripped by safe renderers)

| Field | Value |
|------:|:------|
| script | console.log("XSS?") |
| style | table{border:2px solid red} |
| iframe | |

> If your pipeline strips the above, good. If not, your Markdown â†’ HTML stage should add sanitization.

---

## Final HRs

---
***
___

_EOF_

This file is designed to **break** Markdown table renderers by abusing **HTML tables inside Markdown tables**, nested blockquotes, lists, and code blocks â€” up to **depth 4**.
If your renderer sanitizes HTML, many nested tables will be flattened or removed.
## 1) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ List â†’ Quote â†’ **Markdown Table** w/ **HTML nested table**
> - **L2** List item leading to inner quote
> > **L3** Quote wrapping an outer Markdown table:
## 2) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** â†’ Cell contains **List â†’ Quote â†’ Code**
| | > // L4 fenced code inside the quoted list
## 3) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** â†’ Cell contains **HTML table** â†’ Cell contains **Markdown table**

| Links | [CommonMark spec][cm] and [GFM][gfm] referenced within table (L1). |
[^t1]: Footnote defined outside the table but referenced inside.
## 7) Depthâ€‘4: **Code fence with pipes** embedded to test table parsing edge cases

| > L1 quote | > L1 quote | > L1 quote |
| > - L2 li | > - L2 li | > - L2 li |
## 9) Depthâ€‘4: **GFM table** inside **blockquote** inside **list** inside **blockquote** (max stress)

> If your pipeline strips the above, good. If not, your Markdown â†’ HTML stage should add sanitization.

# ðŸ§ª BRUTAL Markdown Test â€” Nested Tables Edition

This file is designed to **break** Markdown table renderers by abusing **HTML tables inside Markdown tables**, nested blockquotes, lists, and code blocks â€” up to **depth 4**. 
If your renderer sanitizes HTML, many nested tables will be flattened or removed.

---

## 0) Reference Links & Assets
Weâ€™ll reuse refs: [CommonMark][cm], [GFM][gfm], logo: ![logo][logo]

[cm]: https://spec.commonmark.org/
[gfm]: https://github.github.com/gfm/
[logo]: https://via.placeholder.com/60x20?text=MD

---

## 1) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ List â†’ Quote â†’ **Markdown Table** w/ **HTML nested table**

> **L1** Quote
> - **L2** List item leading to inner quote
> > **L3** Quote wrapping an outer Markdown table:
> >
> > | Outer A | Outer B |
> > |:-------:|:-------:|
> > | plain | 
> > 
> > Nested A1Nested A2
> > 
> > 
> > L4 Cell 1L4 Cell 2
> > 
> >

> >

> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > |
> >
> > Row below nested table:
> > | `code` | **bold** |


---

## 2) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** â†’ Cell contains **List â†’ Quote â†’ Code**

| Col A | Col B |
|------:|:------|
| 12345 | - **L1** bullet in table cell 
| | > **L2** quote in table cell 
| | > - **L3** list within quote 
| | > ```js
| | > // L4 fenced code inside the quoted list
| | > export const deep = 4;
| | > ``` |

## 3) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** â†’ Cell contains **HTML table** â†’ Cell contains **Markdown table**

| Level | Content |
|:-----:|:--------|
| L1 | 
| | 
| | HTMLâ€‘L2
| | 
| | MDâ€‘L3 AMDâ€‘L3 B
| | 
| | 
| | | L4 key | L4 val |

| | | a | 1 |
| | 
| | 
| | Nested paragraph with **bold**, *italic*, and `code`.
| | 
| | 
| | 
| | 
| | |


---

## 4) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ **Markdown table** â†’ Cell contains **Checklist** w/ continuation

>
> | Task | Status |

> | Subtasks | - [ ] L1 todo 
> | | - [x] L2 done 
> | | - [ ] L2 todo 
> | | - [ ] L3 deeper 
> | | - [x] **L4 deepest** (done) |
>
> End of quote.


---

## 5) Depthâ€‘4: **List â†’ Markdown Table â†’ HTML table â†’ Fenced Code**

- **Phase 1 (L1)** intro paragraph.
 - **Phase 2 (L2)** we drop a table:
 | K | V |
 |---|---|
 | A | 
 | | HTML L3: value A
 | | 
 | | # L4 fenced block (inside HTML table)
 | | echo nested
 | | 
 | | 
 | | |
 | B | 2 |


---

## 6) Depthâ€‘4: **Markdown Table** with **footnotes, links, images** inside cells

| Feature | Demo |
|:-------:|:-----|
| Footnote | Here is a note[^t1] inside a table cell (L1). |
| Links | [CommonMark spec][cm] and [GFM][gfm] referenced within table (L1). |
| Image | ![logo][logo] |
| Deep | - L1 bullet 
| | > L2 quote inside table 
| | > 1. L3 number 
| | > - L4 bullet |

[^t1]: Footnote defined outside the table but referenced inside.

## 7) Depthâ€‘4: **Code fence with pipes** embedded to test table parsing edge cases

| Pipe | Value |
|------|-------|
| show | ```bash
| | echo "a|b|c"
| | printf "1|2|3\n"
| | ``` |

## 8) Depthâ€‘4: **Table alignment, inline pipes, escapes** with nested quotes

| Left | Center | Right |

| > - L2 li | > - L2 li | > - L2 li |

| > > 1. L4 ordered | > > - L4 bullet | > > `L4 code` |

## 9) Depthâ€‘4: **GFM table** inside **blockquote** inside **list** inside **blockquote** (max stress)

> > Inner quote (L3)

## Final HRs

ðŸ§ª BRUTAL Markdown Test â€” Nested Tables Edition

This file is designed to break Markdown table renderers by abusing HTML tables inside Markdown tables, nested blockquotes, lists, and code blocks â€” up to depth 4.
If your renderer sanitizes HTML, many nested tables will be flattened or removed.

0) Reference Links & Assets Weâ€™ll reuse refs: CommonMark, GFM, logo: 

1) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ List â†’ Quote â†’ Markdown Table w/ HTML nested table

L1 Quote L2 List item leading to inner quote L3 Quote wrapping an outer Markdown table:

Outer AOuter B

plain

Nested A1Nested A2

L4 Cell 1L4 Cell 2

Nestedâ€‘2 ANestedâ€‘2 B

Nestedâ€‘3 XNestedâ€‘3 Y

Inline code at nestedâ€‘2 depth

|

Row below nested table:
| code | bold |

2) Depthâ€‘4: Markdown Table â†’ Cell contains List â†’ Quote â†’ Code

Col ACol B

12345- L1 bullet in table cell > L2 quote in table cell > - L3 list within quote > ```js > // L4 fenced code inside the quoted list > export const deep = 4; > ```

3) Depthâ€‘4: Markdown Table â†’ Cell contains HTML table â†’ Cell contains Markdown table

LevelContent

L1

HTMLâ€‘L2

MDâ€‘L3 AMDâ€‘L3 B

Nested paragraph with bold, italic, and code.

4) Depthâ€‘4: Quote â†’ Markdown table â†’ Cell contains Checklist w/ continuation

Outer context

TaskStatus

Subtasks- [ ] L1 todo - [x] L2 done - [ ] L2 todo - [ ] L3 deeper - [x] L4 deepest (done)

End of quote.

5) Depthâ€‘4: List â†’ Markdown Table â†’ HTML table â†’ Fenced Code

Phase 1 (L1) intro paragraph. Phase 2 (L2) we drop a table:
| K | V |
|---|---|
| A |
| | HTML L3: value A
| |
| | # L4 fenced block (inside HTML table)
| | echo nested
| |
| |
| | |
| B | 2 |

6) Depthâ€‘4: Markdown Table with footnotes, links, images inside cells

FeatureDemo

FootnoteHere is a note[^t1] inside a table cell (L1). LinksCommonMark spec and GFM referenced within table (L1). Image Deep- L1 bullet > L2 quote inside table > 1. L3 number > - L4 bullet

[^t1]: Footnote defined outside the table but referenced inside.

7) Depthâ€‘4: Code fence with pipes embedded to test table parsing edge cases

PipeValue

show```bash echo "a printf "1 ```

8) Depthâ€‘4: Table alignment, inline pipes, escapes with nested quotes

LeftCenterRight

``| text | morebold-10 > L1 quote> L1 quote> L1 quote > - L2 li> - L2 li> - L2 li > > L3> > L3> > L3 > > 1. L4 ordered> > - L4 bullet> > L4 code

9) Depthâ€‘4: GFM table inside blockquote inside list inside blockquote (max stress)

Root quote (L1) List level (L2) Inner quote (L3)

Head AHead B

L4 boldL4 code subsup

10) Sanitization probe: raw tags inside cells (expect to be stripped by safe renderers)

FieldValue

scriptconsole.log("XSS?") styletable{border:2px solid red} iframe

If your pipeline strips the above, good. If not, your Markdown â†’ HTML stage should add sanitization.

Final HRs

EOF

paragraphs.text:
This file is designed to break Markdown table renderers by abusing HTML tables inside Markdown tables, nested blockquotes, lists, and code blocks â€” up to depth 4.
If your renderer sanitizes HTML, many nested tables will be flattened or removed.
Weâ€™ll reuse refs: CommonMark, GFM, logo: logologo
